property.name: Attr1
property.value: If defeated, you may immediately explore again. If undefeated, each character at this location is dealt 1d4 Combat damage.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If defeated, examine the top card of the location deck. If it is a boon, you may add it to your hand. If undefeated, you may banish this barrier.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: The Skeleton is immune to the Mental and Poison traits. If your check to defeat the Skeleton has the Slashing or Piercing trait, the difficulty to defeat the Skeleton is increased by 3. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Before the encounter, recharge a card of your choice from your hand. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If undefeated, discard the top card of your deck. Then, each character at this location must succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 7 check or be dealt 1d4-1 Poison damage. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close your location.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If undefeated, bury 1 item or weapon of your choice from your discard pile.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom 9 check or the difficulty of your checks is increased by 1 for the rest of the turn. Damage dealt by the Bunyip may not be reduced.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If undefeated, shuffle the top card of the blessings deck into this location deck.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: The difficulty to defeat the Enchanter is increased by the adventure deck number of the current scenario, if any. Before the encounter, the Enchanter deals 1 Force damage to you. After the encounter, the Enchanter deals 1 Fire damage to you.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: The Ghost is immune to the Mental and Poison traits. If your check to defeat does not have the Magic trait, the Ghost is undefeated.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: The difficulty to defeat the Mercenary is increased by the adventure deck number of the current scenario, if any.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: "Tell the locals to leave me be or I’ll start tearing heads off their children instead of their livestock." -- Black Fang

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Before the encounter, each character at this locations must succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 7 check or be dealt 1d4-1 Acid damage.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: "Jubrayl Vhiski. Wanted on charges of blackmail, conspiracy, crimes against decency, grave robbing, smuggling, thievery, varied mayhem and murder." --Wanted poster in Magnimar

property.name: Flavour
property.value: "Have any happy pillbugs turned up lately?" --Customer at Pillbug's Pantry, requesting poison

property.name: Attr1
property.value: All damage dealt by Pillbug is Poison damage that may not be reduced

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Recharge this card to add 1d6 to your Perception Check. Banish this card to reduce damage dealt to any character by 3.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Heavy Armor Elite

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Recharge this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 3. Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0; if you are proficient with heavy armors, bury this card instead.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Recharge this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 2. If you are proficient with light armors, you may play another armor on this check. If you played a weapons with the 2-Handed trait on this check, you may not play this card.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Discard this card to add 1 die to a check. Discard this card to add 2 dice to a check to recharge a card. Discard this card to explore your location.

property.name: Recharge
property.value: If the top card of the blessings discard pile matches this card, recharge it instead of discarding it.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If you encounter this card, you automatically acquire it. Discard this card to add 1 die to a check. Discard this card to explore your location. You may instead treat this card as if it were identical to the top card of the blessings discard pile.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Discard this card to add 1 die to your check to acquire a boon.

property.name: Recharge
property.value: Succeed at an Intelligence or Knowledge 10 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Discard this card and choose a character as your location to succeed at a Fortitude check.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your combat check, discard this card to roll your Arcane die + 2d4 with the Force trait. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.

property.name: Recharge
property.value: Succeed at an Arcane 6 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: If you are dealt damage by a monster during your turn, you may discard this card to toll 1d4, and on a result other than 1, reduce the damage to 0. Roll again for each additional source of damage for the rest of the turn. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.

property.name: Recharge
property.value: Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Dexterity or Ranged + 1d4; you may additionally recharge this card to add another 1d4. When playing another weapon, you may discard this card to add 1d4 to the combat check.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Dexterity or Ranged die + 1d4. If you fail a combat check using this weapon, you may discard this card to ignore the result and reroll the dice. You must take the second result.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 1d8; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d6. If you aren’t proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength of Melee die + 1d6; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d6. If you aren’t proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Masters of explosive magic, these wizards can blast any obstacle or foe to dust with a single word of power.
After learning that the father whose name he’d spent most of his adult life trying to clear was indeed guilty, Ezren abandoned his former life and became a wizard. Finding no masters willing to take on an apprentice of his age, he devoted himself to unlocking the mysteries of magic alone. His studies soon revealed a true aptitude for the arcane arts, and he now seeks to explore the world he neglected for so long.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 1 [ ] 2 Spell: 8 [ ] 9 [ ] 10 [ ] 11 Armor: - [ ] 1 Item:3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Blessing: -

property.name: Attr1
property.value: After you play a spell with the Arcane trait, you may examine the top card of your deck; if it’s a spell, you may put it in your hand. If you acquire a card with the Magic trait during an exploration, you may immediately explore again. [ ] Add 1 ([ ] 2)([ ] 3)([ ] 4) to your check to recharge a card. [ ] Add 2 to your Arcane check with the Force ([ ] or Acid and Cold) ([ ] or Electricity and Fire) trait(s). [ ] Add 2 ([ ] 4) to your check to acquire a spell.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d6 Dexterity: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Constitution: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Arcane+2, Knowledge+2 Wisdom: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
These wizards use magical trickery to deceive enemies’ senses, baffling them with impossible sights and frightening sounds.
After learning that the father whose name he’d spent most of his adult life trying to clear was indeed guilty, Ezren abandoned his former life and became a wizard. Finding no masters willing to take on an apprentice of his age, he devoted himself to unlocking the mysteries of magic alone. His studies soon revealed a true aptitude for the arcane arts, and he now seeks to explore the world he neglected for so long.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 1 [ ] 2 Spell: 8 [ ] 9 [ ] 10 [ ] 11 Armor: - [ ] 1 Item:3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Blessing: -

property.name: Attr1
property.value: After you play a spell with the Arcane trait, you may examine the top card of your deck; if it’s a spell, you may put it in your hand ([ ] or recharge it). If you acquire a card with the Magic trait during an exploration, you may immediately explore again. [ ] Add 1 ([ ] 2)([ ] 3)([ ] 4) to your check to recharge a card. [ ] If you play a spell to evade a monster, you may put the monster on the bottom of the deck. [ ] Add 2 ([ ] 4) to your check to acquire a spell ([ ] or ally). [ ] At the start of your turn, you may discard a card to draw a card.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d6 Dexterity: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Constitution: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Arcane+2, Knowledge+2 Wisdom: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Having honed both vision and skill with ranged weapons, these deadly marksmen can strike with incredible precision over impossible distances.
Harsk has always been an unusual sort of dwarf, preferring open skies to cramped underground halls, the flexibility of a crossbow to the sturdiness of an axe, and tea to ale—it keeps his senses sharp. A gruff and driven dwarf, he left his home to fulfill a vow of justice to avenge his brother’s death at the hands of raiding giants. He has since learned much of the world, its lands, its beasts, and its vast array of people and places worth protecting.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 5 [ ] 6 Spell: - [ ] 1 [ ] 2 Armor: 1 [ ] 2 Item: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Ally: 1 [ ] 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr1
property.value: At the end of your turn, you may examine the top card ([ ] or bottom card) of your location deck. You may recharge a card to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2)([ ] +3) ([ ] +4) to a combat check at another location. [ ] When you start your turn with n[ ] cards in your hand, you may draw 1 ([ ] 2) card(s). [ ] When you play a weapon with the Ranged trait, you may recharge it instead of discarding it. [ ] You gain the skill Divine: Wisdom +1. [ ] When you play a blessing to add to your Dexterity check, add d12 instead of the normal die.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
No quarry can escape the keen senses and dogged determination of these masterful hunters.
Harsk has always been an unusual sort of dwarf, preferring open skies to cramped underground halls, the flexibility of a crossbow to the sturdiness of an axe, and tea to ale—it keeps his senses sharp. A gruff and driven dwarf, he left his home to fulfill a vow of justice to avenge his brother’s death at the hands of raiding giants. He has since learned much of the world, its lands, its beasts, and its vast array of people and places worth protecting.

You may recharge a card to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2)([ ] +3) to a combat check at another location. [ ] Add 1d8 ([ ]+1) to your check to defeat a bane with the Giant trait.. [ ] When you play an ally with the Animal trait, you may recharge it instead of discarding it. [ ] You gain the skill Divine: Wisdom +1. [ ] When you play a blessing to add to your Wisdom check, add d12 instead of the normal die.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
These clerics are foes of the undead and unholy, and no unquiet spirit or hungry fiend can stand against their divine wrath.
Kyra and her family grew up near a small temple to Sarenrae, the goddess of healing, honesty, redemption, and the sun. When bandits attacked Kyra’s village, Sarenrae’s priestesses defended the innocent, driving off the raiders at the cost of their lives and their sanctuary. Standing in the burned ruin of the temple, young Kyra swore her life and sword arm to the goddess, promising mercy to the deserving and a quick death to those who spread darkness.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Spell: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Armor: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Item: 1 [ ] 2 Ally: 1 [ ] 2 Blessing: 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Instead of your first exploration on a turn, you may reveal a card with the Divine trait to choose a character at your location. Shuffle 1d4+1 ([ ]+2) random cards from his discard pile into his deck, then discard the card you revealed. Add 1d8 ([ ]+1) with the Magic trait to your check to defeat a bane with the Undead ([ ] or Outsider) trait. [ ] Add 2 to your check to acquire an armor ([ ] or weapon). [ ] When you play Blessing of Sarenrae, you may recharge it ([ ] or place it on top of your deck) instead of discarding it. [ ] If you defeat a bane with the Undead ([ ] or Outsider) trait, you may shuffle 1 random card from your discard pile into your deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
These clerics channel healing power directly from their deity, restoring the defeated and returning the dead to life.
Kyra and her family grew up near a small temple to Sarenrae, the goddess of healing, honesty, redemption, and the sun. When bandits attacked Kyra’s village, Sarenrae’s priestesses defended the innocent, driving off the raiders at the cost of their lives and their sanctuary. Standing in the burned ruin of the temple, young Kyra swore her life and sword arm to the goddess, promising mercy to the deserving and a quick death to those who spread darkness.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Through guile and magic, these charming deceivers play on the hopes and desires of their marks as cannily as on any instrument.
Born a slave to human nobles in a land corrupted by devils, Lem was blessed with a quick wit that earned him easy work as an entertainer. He managed to escape from bondage, but had to leave friends and family behind. Now he fights to ensure that no one else has to bear the burdens that weigh upon his memory. His greatest weapons are his easy laugh, his repertoire of inspirational music and tales, and—when need be—his quick blade.

[ ] When you play Blessing of Shelyn, add d12 instead of the normal die.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
These experienced performers number among the greatest masters of their chosen art forms, transforming performances into forces capable of inspiring armies or crushing dreams.
Born a slave to human nobles in a land corrupted by devils, Lem was blessed with a quick wit that earned him easy work as an entertainer. He managed to escape from bondage, but had to leave friends and family behind. Now he fights to ensure that no one else has to bear the burdens that weigh upon his memory. His greatest weapons are his easy laugh, his repertoire of inspirational music and tales, and—when need be—his quick blade.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Nimble and daring, these daredevils can perform feats of dexterity to avoid any danger or escape any foe.
Orphaned at a young age and raised by humans in the slums, the elf Merisiel saw many friends grow old and die in the decades it took her to become an adult. Unfettered by responsibilities, she now travels where her curiosity takes her, wandering the world with those she calls friends at the time. Merisiel believes in experiencing life to the fullest—you never know when you’ll meet an unexpected end—and that there are few problems a dagger can’t solve.

[ ] When you play a blessing to add to your Dexterity check, you may recharge it instead of discarding it.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Moving silently and unseen, thieves pilfer the greatest treasures from beneath the noses of even the most watchful foes.
Orphaned at a young age and raised by humans in the slums, the elf Merisiel saw many friends grow old and die in the decades it took her to become an adult. Unfettered by responsibilities, she now travels where her curiosity takes her, wandering the world with those she calls friends at the time. Merisiel believes in experiencing life to the fullest—you never know when you’ll meet an unexpected end—and that there are few problems a dagger can’t solve.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
The bloodline of these sorcerers is corrupted by an unholy taint from a fiendish ancestor or other foul influence.
Born into a clan of nomadic wanderers, Seoni wears dozens of runic tattoos that tell the ancient stories of her people and aid her in drawing upon their arcane powers. Quick thinking and with a plan for every situation, she proudly exhibits the marks of her people and endlessly seeks new understanding of her magical abilities. She travels the world, dispelling myths that her people are nothing more than liars and thieves by righting injustices wherever she finds them.

The bloodline of these sorcerers is blessed by a celestial power, either from a celestial ancestor or through divine intervention.
Born into a clan of nomadic wanderers, Seoni wears dozens of runic tattoos that tell the ancient stories of her people and aid her in drawing upon their arcane powers. Quick thinking and with a plan for every situation, she proudly exhibits the marks of her people and endlessly seeks new understanding of her magical abilities. She travels the world, dispelling myths that her people are nothing more than liars and thieves by righting injustices wherever she finds them.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Adept at the use of heavy armors, these fighters hold the line in the face of any assault, defending their allies from even the greatest foes.
Valeros is a good-hearted former mercenary whose longing for adventure convinced him to flee an arranged betrothal to a farmer’s daughter. He trained himself in swordplay and spent many years as a mercenary, but now he fights for those in need. Though noble of heart and fiercely loyal, Valeros hides such sentiments under a jaded and crass demeanor, frequently observing that there’s nothing better than “an evening of hard drinking and soft company.”

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8 Spell: - Armor: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Blessing: 3 [ ] 4

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Add 1d4 ([ ]+1) ([ ]+2)([ ]+3) ([ ]+4) to another character’s combat check at your location. When you play a weapon ([ ] or Armor), you may recharge it instead of discarding it. [ ] When another character at your location is dealt Combat damage, reduce that damage by 1 ([ ] 2). [ ] Add 2 ([ ] 4) to your check to acquire an armor. [ ] When you play a blessing to add to your Constitution check, add d12 instead of the normal die.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d10 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Melee+3 Dexterity: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Constitution: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Intelligence: d6 [ ] +1 Wisdom: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Diplomacy+2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [X] Light Armors, [X] Heavy Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Experts in the use of all weapons—be they bladed, blunt, fired, or thrown—these masterful warriors can turn any tool into a weapon of war.
Valeros is a good-hearted former mercenary whose longing for adventure convinced him to flee an arranged betrothal to a farmer’s daughter. He trained himself in swordplay and spent many years as a mercenary, but now he fights for those in need. Though noble of heart and fiercely loyal, Valeros hides such sentiments under a jaded and crass demeanor, frequently observing that there’s nothing better than “an evening of hard drinking and soft company.”

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8 Spell: - Armor: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Blessing: 3 [ ] 4

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Add 1d4 ([ ]+1) ([ ]+2)([ ]+3) ([ ]+4)([ ]+5) to another character’s combat check at your location. When you play a weapon, you may recharge it ([ ] or shuffle it into your deck) instead of discarding it. [ ] You may use Melee in place of Ranged when using a weapon with the Ranged trait. [ ] Add 2 ([ ] 4) to your check to acquire a weapon. [ ] When you play a blessing to add to your Strength check, add d12 instead of the normal die.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d10 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Melee+3 Dexterity: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Constitution: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Intelligence: d6 [ ] +1 Wisdom: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Diplomacy+2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [X] Light Armors, [X] Heavy Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: After learning that the father whose name he’d spent most of his adult life trying to clear was indeed guilty, Ezren abandoned his former life and became a wizard. Finding no masters willing to take on an apprentice of his age, he devoted himself to unlocking the mysteries of magic alone. His studies soon revealed a true aptitude for the arcane arts, and he now seeks to explore the world he neglected for so long.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 1 [ ] 2 Spell: 8 [ ] 9 [ ] 10 [ ] 11 Armor: - [ ] 1 Item:3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Blessing: -

property.name: Attr1
property.value: After you play a spell with the Arcane trait, you may examine the top card of your deck; if it’s a spell, you may put it in your hand. If you acquire a card with the Magic trait during an exploration, you may immediately explore again. [ ] Add 1 ([ ] 2) to your check to recharge a card.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d6 Dexterity: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Constitution: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Arcane+2, Knowledge+2 Wisdom: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Harsk has always been an unusual sort of dwarf, preferring open skies to cramped underground halls, the flexibility of a crossbow to the sturdiness of an axe, and tea to ale—it keeps his senses sharp. A gruff and driven dwarf, he left his home to fulfill a vow of justice to avenge his brother’s death at the hands of raiding giants. He has since learned much of the world, its lands, its beasts, and its vast array of people and places worth protecting.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 5 [ ] 6 Spell: - [ ] 1 [ ] 2 Armor: 1 [ ] 2 Item: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Ally: 1 [ ] 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr1
property.value: At the end of your turn, you may examine the top card ([ ] or bottom card) of your location deck. You may recharge a card to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2) to a combat check at another location.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Dexterity: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Ranged+3 Constitution: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Fortitude+2 Intelligence: d6 [ ] +1 Wisdom: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Perception+2, Survival+2 Charisma: d4 [ ] +1

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [X] Light Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Kyra and her family grew up near a small temple to Sarenrae, the goddess of healing, honesty, redemption, and the sun. When bandits attacked Kyra’s village, Sarenrae’s priestesses defended the innocent, driving off the raiders at the cost of their lives and their sanctuary. Standing in the burned ruin of the temple, young Kyra swore her life and sword arm to the goddess, promising mercy to the deserving and a quick death to those who spread darkness.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Spell: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Armor: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Item: 1 [ ] 2 Ally: 1 [ ] 2 Blessing: 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Instead of your first exploration on a turn, you may reveal a card with the Divine trait to choose a character at your location. Shuffle 1d4+1 ([ ]+2) random cards from his discard pile into his deck, then discard the card you revealed. Add 1d8 ([ ]+1) with the Magic trait to your check to defeat a bane with the Undead trait.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Melee+2 Dexterity: d4 [ ] +1 Constitution: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Fortitude+3 Intelligence: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Wisdom: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Divine+2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [X] Light Armors, [X] Heavy Armors, [ ] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Born a slave to human nobles in a land corrupted by devils, Lem was blessed with a quick wit that earned him easy work as an entertainer. He managed to escape from bondage, but had to leave friends and family behind. Now he fights to ensure that no one else has to bear the burdens that weigh upon his memory. His greatest weapons are his easy laugh, his repertoire of inspirational music and tales, and—when need be—his quick blade.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 1 [ ] 2 [ ] 3 Spell: 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Armor: - [ ] 1 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Your choice

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Once per check, you may recharge a card to add 1d4 ([ ]+1) ([ ]+2) to a check attempted by another character at your location. At the start of your turn, you may exchange 1 card in your hand with 1 card of the same type in your discard pile.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Dexterity: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Constitution: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Knowledge+3 Wisdom: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Charisma: d10 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Arcane+1, Divine+1, Diplomacy+3

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [ ] Light Armors, [ ] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Orphaned at a young age and raised by humans in the slums, the elf Merisiel saw many friends grow old and die in the decades it took her to become an adult. Unfettered by responsibilities, she now travels where her curiosity takes her, wandering the world with those she calls friends at the time. Merisiel believes in experiencing life to the fullest—you never know when you’ll meet an unexpected end—and that there are few problems a dagger can’t solve.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Spell: - [ ] 1 Armor: 1 [ ] 2 Item: 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8 [ ] 9 Ally: 2 [ ] 3 Blessing: 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr1
property.value: You may evade your encounter. If you are the only character at your location, you may recharge a card to add 1d6 ([ ]+1)([ ]+2) to your combat check, or discard it to add an additional 1d6.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Dexterity: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Acrobatics+2, Disable+2, Stealth+2 Constitution: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d4 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Wisdom: d6 [ ] +1 Perception+2 Charisma: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [X] Light Armors, [ ] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Born into a clan of nomadic wanderers, Seoni wears dozens of runic tattoos that tell the ancient stories of her people and aid her in drawing upon their arcane powers. Quick thinking and with a plan for every situation, she proudly exhibits the marks of her people and endlessly seeks new understanding of her magical abilities. She travels the world, dispelling myths that her people are nothing more than liars and thieves by righting injustices wherever she finds them.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: - [ ] 1 Spell: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Armor: - Item: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Ally: 4 [ ] 5 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your combat check, you may discard a card to roll your Arcane die + 1d6 ([ ]+1)([ ]+2) with the Attack, Fire, and Magic traits. This counts as playing a spell. You automatically succeed at your check to recharge a spell ([ ] or item) with the Arcane trait.

property.name: Attr2

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Valeros is a good-hearted former mercenary whose longing for adventure convinced him to flee an arranged betrothal to a farmer’s daughter. He trained himself in swordplay and spent many years as a mercenary, but now he fights for those in need. Though noble of heart and fiercely loyal, Valeros hides such sentiments under a jaded and crass demeanor, frequently observing that there’s nothing better than “an evening of hard drinking and soft company.”

property.name: Attr2

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Add 1d4 ([ ]+1) ([ ]+2) to another character’s combat check at your location. When you play a weapon, you may recharge it instead of discarding it.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 5 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: On your first exploration on a turn, if you encounter anything other than a spell, after the exploration you may explore again.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at an Intelligence or Arcane 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, you may shuffle a spell from your discard pile into your deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The academy serves as a place of learning for those who study the deeper secrets of the world – weather the wonders of the modern world, forgotten histories, or the mysteries of the arcane arts. Wide processors are always willing to share their council with those who take the time to listen, and wily students will often sell a scroll or two to those who know how to ask.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 0 Weapon 1 Spell 3 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 2

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you did not explore this turn, after you reset your hand, you may shuffle the top 1d6 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at an Intelligence or Craft 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Glass jars filled with dried herbs and jewel-like potions gleam in the soft light of this shop. While most are well labeled, it’s impossible to tell if some are healing tinctures of deadly poisons.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 2 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you fail a combat check, shuffle random monster from the box into the location deck.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat a bandit henchmen.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Alert and capable guards hold their posts questioning visitors and checking cargo at this fortified entry into the community. Between the guards stand strong gates and a sturdy portcullis, the wood and steel of these solid barriers showing scratches and scores acquired while defending against unwelcome strangers, would be invaders and worse.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 4 Barrier 2 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: The difficulty of combat checks is increased by 1.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 8 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The air grows cold and stale as these dank passageways descend deeper into the earth. These halls seem older and wilder than those above; their walls are etched with mysterious symbols and their shadows are infested with things unused to light. The sound of grinding stone echoes through the passage, as if some great vault door were being forced open. Whatever might remain down there must be patient indeed.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 4 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 2 Ally 0 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you would defeat a bane with the Undead trait here, roll 1d6. On a 1, the monster is undefeated.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Wisdom or Divine 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, each character at this location may recharge an item from their discard pile.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Sobbing angels and snarling fields leer from the crumbling heights of this overgrown mausoleum. Ages have passed since anyone cared for the bodies sheltered within, evidenced by the grim vault’s dilapidated statuary and its forced open heavy stone doors. The echoes of something murmuring within suggest that whatever lurks here now doesn’t rest in peace.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 3 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you would discard an ally, bury it instead.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat a random monster.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Tall plants dominate the land around this otherwise unremarkable little farmhouse – high stalks and thick leaves turn the rows beneath crops into oppressive tunnels. Nearby stand the fields and muddy pens of various farm animals, through most are strangely empty. Between the fields and the house lie scattering farming implements, abandoned and left to rust.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 0 Weapon 3 Spell 0 Armor 2 Item 0 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you encounter a monster other than a villain or a henchmen, each character at this location must summon and encounter that monster.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat a Bandit henchmen with the combat difficulty increased by 2.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, shuffle together any [X] Weapons and armor remaining in this deck and place them under this location.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The solid stone fortress serves as militia barracks, armory and town jail – although the latter is generally empty save for drunks and a few petty criminals. Should the surrounding farms and villages ever face danger, this will be the rallying point for the region’s guardians, where farmers and shopkeepers become defenders of the land.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 0 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 3 Ally 1 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you encounter anything other than armor, and item, or a weapon, after the exploration you may explore again.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Banish a card from your hand.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, and 1d6 random items to this location without looking at them, then automatically acquire the top card.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Customers can find a little bit of everything in the town’s best-stocked general store – mundane goods, weapons and armor, even the occasional potion. Aside from wares both common and extraordinary, the shop also serves as a gathering place for all sorts of town gossip, and the store’s owner is among the best informed and connected folks around.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 2 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: At the start of your turn, summon and encounter a bandit henchmen.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at Strength 5 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, you may banish a card from your hand to draw a random ally from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: This open-air tower provides a commanding view of the area’s tangled brush, rugged coastlines, and distances far beyond, making it the perfect vantage for anyone assigned to keep watch over the area. Traces of circling footprints can still be read on the dirt-caked floor, as well as the nick and scratches of weapons – perhaps from the weapons of those who didn’t wish to be seen.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 3 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: At the start of your turn, Succeed at a Wisdom or Survival 7 check or bury a card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at Wisdom or Survival 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: At the end of your turn you may examine the top card of an open location deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The mountains jagged peak lances into the sky, skewering clouds and attempting to pierce the heavens themselves. No obvious path leads through the mazes of boulders and walls of cliffs that line its slopes, making the summit a seemingly impregnable natural fortress. As it that weren’t intimidating enough, a screech from on high suggests that even this fortress has its defenders.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You may attempt a Dexterity or Disable 8 check in place of the usual check to acquire a boon.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed in a Charisma or Diplomacy 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, you may shuffle ally from your discard pile into your deck.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Crude but sturdy bars divide this chamber into several cramped, shadowy cells. Within each lie rusted manacles and the evidence of past prisoners – occasionally even stray bones from those who died in the care of their jailers. Somewhere in the darkness something rattles its chains but who can say how reliable those restraints might actually be?

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 0 Weapon 0 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 1 Blessing 3

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you defeat a monster, you may add a blessing from your discard pile to your hand.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Banish either a blessing or father Zantus.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: When you end your turn here, you may attempt a Wisdom 6 check to recharge a blessing from your discard pile

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The grandest building in the town, Sandpoint’s new cathedral is dedicated to the six deities worshiped by the towns founders: Abadar, Desna, Erastil, Gozreh, Sarenrae and Shelyn.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 0 Ally 0 Blessing 3

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you encounter a blessing, you are dealt two points of mental damage that may not be reduced.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a divine 6 check or banish a blessing.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, you may banish a blessing to draw a random blessing from the box.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters, demon-goddess of madness, monsters and nightmares, numbers among the most vicious and terrifying of Golariou’s deities. Here, worn steps lead to a blood-strained platform on which stands an ancient altar, little more than a jagged block of black marble. A sense of malice and unnamable fear hands over the place

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 0 Barrier 0 Weapon 2 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 4

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you move or are moved here, discard a card. Any player at another location may evade an encounter and move here, discarding 2 cards instead of the normal 1 then reset their hand and end their turn.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: You may close this location automatically.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Old but still impressive, a temple rises from the undergrowth, its ancient stones pocked by time and weather. Numerous narrow windows peer into its darkened interior.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 3 Armor 1 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: If you play a spell with the Arcane trait, you may immediately draw a card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at an Intelligence or Arcane 7 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Jagged runes adorn the surfaces of this unfathomably ancient ruin. In places it look as if whole walls should fall away into rubble, but unseen forces work to hold them in place.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 4 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Add 1d6 to checks using the Fire trait.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at an Intelligence or Knowledge 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: A crumbling tower rises from the cliff west of Sandpoint. Predating the town itself, the spire is thought to be a ruined lighthouse, but some claim it has a more mysterious history.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 1 Armor 1 Item 2 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: At the start of your turn, you may recharge an item to draw a card.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Charisma or Diplomacy 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Hung with black-and-red striped firepelt skins, dog pelts and horsehides, the walls of this savage, reeking room also sport impaled hands. The throne is adorned with a variety of cracked skulls.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 2 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You may discard a card from your hand it to explore during your turn. This card may not be recharged.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Banish a card from your hand.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, each character at this location must immediately choose a card and recharge it; each character may then draw a card.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: All the sound and life of the community comes together at this well-trodden square at the heart oF town. People of all walks enjoy themselves here as they go about their daily business, whether it be shopping for goods, hawking their wares, or meeting with friends – but even here there are those who lurk in the shadows, eyeing marks for more nefarious purposes.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 0 Armor 2 Item 2 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You must succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 6 check to move or be moved to another location.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Wisdom or Survival 7 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Hidden at the base of an overgrown cliff, the entrance to this cave yawns open, black and ominous. The crude carvings surrounding its opening imply that this is no natural cavern. Perhaps it’s the home of the permit, a smugglers den, or the lair of something worse. Regardless, there’s no easy way down to the entrance, suggesting that whoever or whatever claims this place doesn’t welcome visitors.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 1 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 3 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When attempting a check to acquire an ally, you may instead recharge a card to automatically acquire the ally.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Banish a card from your hand.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Although a far cry from the mansions of wealthy nobles or the keeps of powerful lords, this cozy house has the look of a comfortable and reasonably well kept home. Warm light pours from the windows, gilding the silhouettes of the occupants going about their lives inside, and colorful birdfeeders and wind chimes give it a bit of personality.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 2 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When you encounter monster, put a random monster from the box on top of another random open location deck.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Dexterity or Acrobatics 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: It’s entrance marred by dozens of tiny claws, the mouth of this dirt tunnel yawns as if ready to disgorge hordes of monstrosities. Soft scurrying noises echo through the twisting dirt tunnels which bend dizzyingly, narrowing to only a few feet wide at points. The light catches the pale color of bone within but also the glint of something that shimmers.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 4 Barrier 2 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 2 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: When using a weapon, subtract one from each die rolled. After your exploration, you may discard 2 cards to explore again.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Summon and defeat a Bandit henchmen.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: On closing, all characters at this location discard a card.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The bustling waterfront houses many of the community shops and industries, and serves as one of the primary gateways for travelers. Among the masts and colors of foreign ships, and fishermen rub shoulders with sailors and visitors from across the world – strangers who always bring with them exotic cargo and wild stories.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 0 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 0 Ally 3 Blessing 1

property.name: Attr2
property.value: You may discard 2 cards to evade an encounter.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at a Dexterity or Stealth 6 check

property.name: Attr4
property.value: When you end your turn here you may bury a card from your hand to recharge a card from your discard pile.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: A fragile bridge creaks and sways in the wind above a sheer ravine. The planks and hairy ropes have seen better days, but if careful, someone could probably make it across.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Monster 4 Barrier 2 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 2 Ally 0 Blessing 0

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Undefeated monsters other than villains are henchmen are banished.

property.name: Attr3
property.value: Succeed at Wisdom or Survival 6 check.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: No effect.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Gnarled and twisted branches support a shadowy forest canopy that allows only enough light to encourage the growth of stinging nettles and other poisonous plants. Despite the tangled plants, swift, sly things dart through the underbrush, but whether they are curious creatures of the woods or hungry predators is difficult to tell.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Brigandoom! The Poison Pill Black Fang's Dungeon

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Each character gains a skill feat

property.value: Burnt Offerings The Skinsaw Murders The Hook Mountain Massacre Fortress of the Stone Giants Sins of the Saviors Spires of Xin-Shalast

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Each character gains a card feat

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Something the local farmers have taken to calling Black Fang has been killing livestock around Sandpoint. Those who have tracked the beast to its lair found a cave connecting to mysterious ancient ruins. Delve into Black Fang's lair and end the evils there before they threaten Sandpoint!

property.value: When any character encounters an Ancient Skeleton henchman, each other character at that location must summon and encounter an Ancient Skeleton henchman.
